text:
Does anyone know if there is a different way of getting a workflow ID...?

I find it a bit cumbersome sometimes when i'm creating new workflows manually in HubSpot, to then have to make a separate API call to get the ID. I've got around 350 live workflows so it's always a bit of a hassle to dig through the response and find the right one.
Not the end of the world, but would be great if that ID worked similarly to property internal references where you could find it directly in the workflow settings somewhere? (unless that is possible and I've completely missed it?)

Hi <@U06H94JKK1P> :wave: the Workflow ID is visible within the URL (when viewing/editing a specific Workflow). For example, if I'm editing a Workflow, the URL should look something like this:
```<https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/workflows/12345/platform/flow/67890/edit>```
In this example, the first number (left to right - 12345) is the HubSpot Portal ID. The second number (left to right - 67890) is the Workflow ID. I hope that helps :slightly_smiling_face:
